67  import static org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.SplitLogManager.ResubmitDirective.*;
68  import static org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.SplitLogManager.TerminationStatus.*;

70  /**
71   * Distributes the task of log splitting to the available region servers.
72   * Coordination happens via zookeeper. For every log file that has to be split a
73   * znode is created under /hbase/splitlog. SplitLogWorkers race to grab a task.
74   *
75   * SplitLogManager monitors the task znodes that it creates using the
76   * timeoutMonitor thread. If a task's progress is slow then
77   * resubmit(String, boolean) will take away the task from the owner
78   * {@link SplitLogWorker} and the task will be
79   * upforgrabs again. When the task is done then the task's znode is deleted by
80   * SplitLogManager.
81   *
82   * Clients call {@link #splitLogDistributed(Path)} to split a region server's
83   * log files. The caller thread waits in this method until all the log files
84   * have been split.
85   *
86   * All the zookeeper calls made by this class are asynchronous. This is mainly
87   * to help reduce response time seen by the callers.
88   *
89   * There is race in this design between the SplitLogManager and the
90   * SplitLogWorker. SplitLogManager might re-queue a task that has in reality
91   * already been completed by a SplitLogWorker. We rely on the idempotency of
92   * the log splitting task for correctness.
93   *
94   * It is also assumed that every log splitting task is unique and once
95   * completed (either with success or with error) it will be not be submitted
96   * again. If a task is resubmitted then there is a risk that old "delete task"
97   * can delete the re-submission.
98   */
99  public class SplitLogManager extends ZooKeeperListener {
100   private static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(SplitLogManager.class);
101 
102   private final Stoppable stopper;
103   private final MasterServices master;
104   private final String serverName;
105   private final TaskFinisher taskFinisher;
106   private FileSystem fs;
107   private Configuration conf;
108 
109   private long zkretries;
110   private long resubmit_threshold;
111   private long timeout;
112   private long unassignedTimeout;
113   private long lastNodeCreateTime = Long.MAX_VALUE;
114   public boolean ignoreZKDeleteForTesting = false;
115 
116   private final ConcurrentMap<String, Task> tasks =
117     new ConcurrentHashMap<String, Task>();
118   private TimeoutMonitor timeoutMonitor;
119 
120   private Set<String> deadWorkers = null;
121   private final Object deadWorkersLock = new Object();
122 
123   private Set<String> failedDeletions = null;
124 
125   /**
126    * Wrapper around {@link #SplitLogManager(ZooKeeperWatcher, Configuration,
127    * Stoppable, String, TaskFinisher)} that provides a task finisher for
128    * copying recovered edits to their final destination. The task finisher
129    * has to be robust because it can be arbitrarily restarted or called
130    * multiple times.
131    * 
132    * @param zkw
133    * @param conf
134    * @param stopper
135    * @param serverName
136    */
137   public SplitLogManager(ZooKeeperWatcher zkw, final Configuration conf,
138       Stoppable stopper, MasterServices master, String serverName) {
139     this(zkw, conf, stopper, master, serverName, new TaskFinisher() {
140       @Override
141       public Status finish(String workerName, String logfile) {
142         try {
143           HLogSplitter.finishSplitLogFile(logfile, conf);
144         } catch (IOException e) {
145           LOG.warn("Could not finish splitting of log file " + logfile, e);
146           return Status.ERR;
147         }
148         return Status.DONE;
149       }
150     });
151   }
152 
153   /**
154    * Its OK to construct this object even when region-servers are not online. It
155    * does lookup the orphan tasks in zk but it doesn't block waiting for them
156    * to be done.
157    *
158    * @param zkw
159    * @param conf
160    * @param stopper
161    * @param serverName
162    * @param tf task finisher 
163    */
164   public SplitLogManager(ZooKeeperWatcher zkw, Configuration conf,
165       Stoppable stopper, MasterServices master, String serverName, TaskFinisher tf) {
166     super(zkw);
167     this.taskFinisher = tf;
168     this.conf = conf;
169     this.stopper = stopper;
170     this.master = master;
171     this.zkretries = conf.getLong("hbase.splitlog.zk.retries",
172         ZKSplitLog.DEFAULT_ZK_RETRIES);
173     this.resubmit_threshold = conf.getLong("hbase.splitlog.max.resubmit",
174         ZKSplitLog.DEFAULT_MAX_RESUBMIT);
175     this.timeout = conf.getInt("hbase.splitlog.manager.timeout",
176         ZKSplitLog.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT);
177     this.unassignedTimeout =
178       conf.getInt("hbase.splitlog.manager.unassigned.timeout",
179         ZKSplitLog.DEFAULT_UNASSIGNED_TIMEOUT);
180     LOG.info("timeout = " + timeout);
181     LOG.info("unassigned timeout = " + unassignedTimeout);
182     LOG.info("resubmit threshold = " + this.resubmit_threshold);
183 
184     this.serverName = serverName;
185     this.timeoutMonitor = new TimeoutMonitor(
186         conf.getInt("hbase.splitlog.manager.timeoutmonitor.period",
187             1000),
188         stopper);
189 
190     this.failedDeletions = Collections.synchronizedSet(new HashSet<String>());
191   }
192 
193   public void finishInitialization(boolean masterRecovery) {
194     if (!masterRecovery) {
195       Threads.setDaemonThreadRunning(timeoutMonitor.getThread(), serverName
196           + ".splitLogManagerTimeoutMonitor");
197     }
198     // Watcher can be null during tests with Mock'd servers.
199     if (this.watcher != null) {
200       this.watcher.registerListener(this);
201       lookForOrphans();
202     }
203   }
204 
205   private FileStatus[] getFileList(List<Path> logDirs) throws IOException {
206     List<FileStatus> fileStatus = new ArrayList<FileStatus>();
207     for (Path hLogDir : logDirs) {
208       this.fs = hLogDir.getFileSystem(conf);
209       if (!fs.exists(hLogDir)) {
210         LOG.warn(hLogDir + " doesn't exist. Nothing to do!");
211         continue;
212       }
213       // TODO filter filenames?
214       FileStatus[] logfiles = FSUtils.listStatus(fs, hLogDir, null);
215       if (logfiles == null || logfiles.length == 0) {
216         LOG.info(hLogDir + " is empty dir, no logs to split");
217       } else {
218         for (FileStatus status : logfiles)
219           fileStatus.add(status);
220       }
221     }
222     FileStatus[] a = new FileStatus[fileStatus.size()];
223     return fileStatus.toArray(a);
224   }
225 
226   /**
227    * @param logDir
228    *            one region sever hlog dir path in .logs
229    * @throws IOException
230    *             if there was an error while splitting any log file
231    * @return cumulative size of the logfiles split
232    * @throws IOException 
233    */
234   public long splitLogDistributed(final Path logDir) throws IOException {
235     List<Path> logDirs = new ArrayList<Path>();
236     logDirs.add(logDir);
237     return splitLogDistributed(logDirs);
238   }
239   /**
240    * The caller will block until all the log files of the given region server
241    * have been processed - successfully split or an error is encountered - by an
242    * available worker region server. This method must only be called after the
243    * region servers have been brought online.
244    *
245    * @param logDirs
246    * @throws IOException
247    *          if there was an error while splitting any log file
248    * @return cumulative size of the logfiles split
249    */
250   public long splitLogDistributed(final List<Path> logDirs) throws IOException {
251     MonitoredTask status = TaskMonitor.get().createStatus(
252           "Doing distributed log split in " + logDirs);
253     FileStatus[] logfiles = getFileList(logDirs);
254     status.setStatus("Checking directory contents...");
255     LOG.debug("Scheduling batch of logs to split");
256     tot_mgr_log_split_batch_start.incrementAndGet();
257     LOG.info("started splitting logs in " + logDirs);
258     long t = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
259     long totalSize = 0;
260     TaskBatch batch = new TaskBatch();
261     for (FileStatus lf : logfiles) {
262       // TODO If the log file is still being written to - which is most likely
263       // the case for the last log file - then its length will show up here
264       // as zero. The size of such a file can only be retrieved after
265       // recover-lease is done. totalSize will be under in most cases and the
266       // metrics that it drives will also be under-reported.
267       totalSize += lf.getLen();
268       if (enqueueSplitTask(lf.getPath().toString(), batch) == false) {
269         throw new IOException("duplicate log split scheduled for "
270             + lf.getPath());
271       }
272     }
273     waitForSplittingCompletion(batch, status);
274     if (batch.done != batch.installed) {
275       batch.isDead = true;
276       tot_mgr_log_split_batch_err.incrementAndGet();
277       LOG.warn("error while splitting logs in " + logDirs +
278       " installed = " + batch.installed + " but only " + batch.done + " done");
279       String msg = "error or interrupted while splitting logs in "
280         + logDirs + " Task = " + batch;
281       status.abort(msg);
282       throw new IOException(msg);
283     }
284     for(Path logDir: logDirs){
285       status.setStatus("Cleaning up log directory...");
286       try {
287         if (fs.exists(logDir) && !HBaseFileSystem.deleteFileFromFileSystem(fs, logDir)) {
288           LOG.warn("Unable to delete log src dir. Ignoring. " + logDir);
289         }
290       } catch (IOException ioe) {
291         FileStatus[] files = fs.listStatus(logDir);
292         if (files != null && files.length > 0) {
293           LOG.warn("returning success without actually splitting and " + 
294               "deleting all the log files in path " + logDir);
295         } else {
296           LOG.warn("Unable to delete log src dir. Ignoring. " + logDir, ioe);
297         }
298       }
299       tot_mgr_log_split_batch_success.incrementAndGet();
300     }
301     String msg = "finished splitting (more than or equal to) " + totalSize +
302         " bytes in " + batch.installed + " log files in " + logDirs + " in " +
303         (EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis() - t) + "ms";
304     status.markComplete(msg);
305     LOG.info(msg);
306     return totalSize;
307   }
308 
309   /**
310    * Add a task entry to splitlog znode if it is not already there.
311    * 
312    * @param taskname the path of the log to be split
313    * @param batch the batch this task belongs to
314    * @return true if a new entry is created, false if it is already there.
315    */
316   boolean enqueueSplitTask(String taskname, TaskBatch batch) {
317     tot_mgr_log_split_start.incrementAndGet();
318     String path = ZKSplitLog.getEncodedNodeName(watcher, taskname);
319     Task oldtask = createTaskIfAbsent(path, batch);
320     if (oldtask == null) {
321       // publish the task in zk
322       createNode(path, zkretries);
323       return true;
324     }
325     return false;
326   }
327 
328   private void waitForSplittingCompletion(TaskBatch batch, MonitoredTask status) {
329     synchronized (batch) {
330       while ((batch.done + batch.error) != batch.installed) {
331         try {
332           status.setStatus("Waiting for distributed tasks to finish. "
333               + " scheduled=" + batch.installed
334               + " done=" + batch.done
335               + " error=" + batch.error);
336           int remaining = batch.installed - (batch.done + batch.error);
337           int actual = activeTasks(batch);
338           if (remaining != actual) {
339             LOG.warn("Expected " + remaining
340               + " active tasks, but actually there are " + actual);
341           }
342           int remainingInZK = remainingTasksInZK();
343           if (remainingInZK >= 0 && actual > remainingInZK) {
344             LOG.warn("Expected at least" + actual
345               + " tasks in ZK, but actually there are " + remainingInZK);
346           }
347           if (remainingInZK == 0 || actual == 0) {
348             LOG.warn("No more task remaining (ZK or task map), splitting "
349               + "should have completed. Remaining tasks in ZK " + remainingInZK
350               + ", active tasks in map " + actual);
351             if (remainingInZK == 0 && actual == 0) {
352               return;
353             }
354           }
355           batch.wait(100);
356           if (stopper.isStopped()) {
357             LOG.warn("Stopped while waiting for log splits to be completed");
358             return;
359           }
360         } catch (InterruptedException e) {
361           LOG.warn("Interrupted while waiting for log splits to be completed");
362           Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
363           return;
364         }
365       }
366     }
367   }
368 
369   private int activeTasks(final TaskBatch batch) {
370     int count = 0;
371     for (Task t: tasks.values()) {
372       if (t.batch == batch && t.status == TerminationStatus.IN_PROGRESS) {
373         count++;
374       }
375     }
376     return count;
377   }
378 
379   private int remainingTasksInZK() {
380     int count = 0;
381     try {
382       List<String> tasks =
383         ZKUtil.listChildrenNoWatch(watcher, watcher.splitLogZNode);
384       if (tasks != null) {
385         for (String t: tasks) {
386           if (!ZKSplitLog.isRescanNode(watcher, t)) {
387             count++;
388           }
389         }
390       }
391     } catch (KeeperException ke) {
392       LOG.warn("Failed to check remaining tasks", ke);
393       count = -1;
394     }
395     return count;
396   }
397 
398   private void setDone(String path, TerminationStatus status) {
399     Task task = tasks.get(path);
400     if (task == null) {
401       if (!ZKSplitLog.isRescanNode(watcher, path)) {
402         tot_mgr_unacquired_orphan_done.incrementAndGet();
403         LOG.debug("unacquired orphan task is done " + path);
404       }
405     } else {
406       synchronized (task) {
407         if (task.status == IN_PROGRESS) {
408           if (status == SUCCESS) {
409             tot_mgr_log_split_success.incrementAndGet();
410             LOG.info("Done splitting " + path);
411           } else {
412             tot_mgr_log_split_err.incrementAndGet();
413             LOG.warn("Error splitting " + path);
414           }
415           task.status = status;
416           if (task.batch != null) {
417             synchronized (task.batch) {
418               if (status == SUCCESS) {
419                 task.batch.done++;
420               } else {
421                 task.batch.error++;
422               }
423               task.batch.notify();
424             }
425           }
426         }
427       }
428     }
429     // delete the task node in zk. It's an async
430     // call and no one is blocked waiting for this node to be deleted. All
431     // task names are unique (log.<timestamp>) there is no risk of deleting
432     // a future task.
433     // if a deletion fails, TimeoutMonitor will retry the same deletion later
434     deleteNode(path, zkretries);
435     return;
436   }
437 
438   private void createNode(String path, Long retry_count) {
439     ZKUtil.asyncCreate(this.watcher, path,
440         TaskState.TASK_UNASSIGNED.get(serverName), new CreateAsyncCallback(),
441         retry_count);
442     tot_mgr_node_create_queued.incrementAndGet();
443     return;
444   }
445 
446   private void createNodeSuccess(String path) {
447     lastNodeCreateTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
448     LOG.debug("put up splitlog task at znode " + path);
449     getDataSetWatch(path, zkretries);
450   }
451 
452   private void createNodeFailure(String path) {
453     // TODO the Manager should split the log locally instead of giving up
454     LOG.warn("failed to create task node" + path);
455     setDone(path, FAILURE);
456   }
457 
458 
459   private void getDataSetWatch(String path, Long retry_count) {
460     this.watcher.getRecoverableZooKeeper().getZooKeeper().
461         getData(path, this.watcher,
462         new GetDataAsyncCallback(), retry_count);
463     tot_mgr_get_data_queued.incrementAndGet();
464   }
465 
466   private void tryGetDataSetWatch(String path) {
467     // A negative retry count will lead to ignoring all error processing.
468     this.watcher.getRecoverableZooKeeper().getZooKeeper().
469         getData(path, this.watcher,
470         new GetDataAsyncCallback(), new Long(-1) /* retry count */);
471     tot_mgr_get_data_queued.incrementAndGet();
472   }
473 
474   private void getDataSetWatchSuccess(String path, byte[] data, int version) {
475     if (data == null) {
476       if (version == Integer.MIN_VALUE) {
477         // assume all done. The task znode suddenly disappeared.
478         setDone(path, SUCCESS);
479         return;
480       }
481       tot_mgr_null_data.incrementAndGet();
482       LOG.fatal("logic error - got null data " + path);
483       setDone(path, FAILURE);
484       return;
485     }
486     data = this.watcher.getRecoverableZooKeeper().removeMetaData(data);
487     // LOG.debug("set watch on " + path + " got data " + new String(data));
488     if (TaskState.TASK_UNASSIGNED.equals(data)) {
489       LOG.debug("task not yet acquired " + path + " ver = " + version);
490       handleUnassignedTask(path);
491     } else if (TaskState.TASK_OWNED.equals(data)) {
492       heartbeat(path, version,
493           TaskState.TASK_OWNED.getWriterName(data));
494     } else if (TaskState.TASK_RESIGNED.equals(data)) {
495       LOG.info("task " + path + " entered state " + new String(data));
496       resubmitOrFail(path, FORCE);
497     } else if (TaskState.TASK_DONE.equals(data)) {
498       LOG.info("task " + path + " entered state " + new String(data));
499       if (taskFinisher != null && !ZKSplitLog.isRescanNode(watcher, path)) {
500         if (taskFinisher.finish(TaskState.TASK_DONE.getWriterName(data),
501             ZKSplitLog.getFileName(path)) == Status.DONE) {
502           setDone(path, SUCCESS);
503         } else {
504           resubmitOrFail(path, CHECK);
505         }
506       } else {
507         setDone(path, SUCCESS);
508       }
509     } else if (TaskState.TASK_ERR.equals(data)) {
510       LOG.info("task " + path + " entered state " + new String(data));
511       resubmitOrFail(path, CHECK);
512     } else {
513       LOG.fatal("logic error - unexpected zk state for path = " + path
514           + " data = " + new String(data));
515       setDone(path, FAILURE);
516     }
517   }
518 
519   private void getDataSetWatchFailure(String path) {
520     LOG.warn("failed to set data watch " + path);
521     setDone(path, FAILURE);
522   }
523 
524   /**
525    * It is possible for a task to stay in UNASSIGNED state indefinitely - say
526    * SplitLogManager wants to resubmit a task. It forces the task to UNASSIGNED
527    * state but it dies before it could create the RESCAN task node to signal
528    * the SplitLogWorkers to pick up the task. To prevent this scenario the
529    * SplitLogManager resubmits all orphan and UNASSIGNED tasks at startup.
530    *
531    * @param path
532    */
533   private void handleUnassignedTask(String path) {
534     if (ZKSplitLog.isRescanNode(watcher, path)) {
535       return;
536     }
537     Task task = findOrCreateOrphanTask(path);
538     if (task.isOrphan() && (task.incarnation == 0)) {
539       LOG.info("resubmitting unassigned orphan task " + path);
540       // ignore failure to resubmit. The timeout-monitor will handle it later
541       // albeit in a more crude fashion
542       resubmit(path, task, FORCE);
543     }
544   }
545 
546   /**
547    * Helper function to check whether to abandon retries in ZooKeeper AsyncCallback functions
548    * @param statusCode integer value of a ZooKeeper exception code
549    * @param action description message about the retried action
550    * @return true when need to abandon retries, otherwise false
551    */
552   private boolean shouldAbandonRetries(int statusCode, String action) {
553     if (statusCode == KeeperException.Code.SESSIONEXPIRED.intValue()) {
554       LOG.error("ZK session expired. Master is expected to shut down. Abandoning retries for "
555           + "action=" + action);
556       return true;
557     }
558     return false;
559   }
560 
561   private void heartbeat(String path, int new_version,
562       String workerName) {
563     Task task = findOrCreateOrphanTask(path);
564     if (new_version != task.last_version) {
565       if (task.isUnassigned()) {
566         LOG.info("task " + path + " acquired by " + workerName);
567       }
568       task.heartbeat(EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis(),
569           new_version, workerName);
570       tot_mgr_heartbeat.incrementAndGet();
571     } else {
572       // duplicate heartbeats - heartbeats w/o zk node version
573       // changing - are possible. The timeout thread does
574       // getDataSetWatch() just to check whether a node still
575       // exists or not
576     }
577     return;
578   }
579 
580   private boolean resubmit(String path, Task task,
581       ResubmitDirective directive) {
582     // its ok if this thread misses the update to task.deleted. It will
583     // fail later
584     if (task.status != IN_PROGRESS) {
585       return false;
586     }
587     int version;
588     if (directive != FORCE) {
589       // We're going to resubmit:
590       // 1) immediately if the worker server is now marked as dead
591       // 2) after a configurable timeout if the server is not marked as dead but has still not
592       // finished the task. This allows to continue if the worker cannot actually handle it,
593       // for any reason.
594       final long time = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis() - task.last_update;
595       ServerName curWorker = null;
596       if (!Strings.isNullOrEmpty(task.cur_worker_name)) {
597         try {
598           curWorker = ServerName.parseServerName(task.cur_worker_name);
599         } catch (IllegalArgumentException ie) {
600           LOG.error("Got invalid server name:" + task.cur_worker_name + " - task for path:" + path
601               + " won't be resubmitted before timeout");
602         }
603       } else {
604         LOG.error("Got empty/null server name:" + task.cur_worker_name + " - task for path:" + path
605             + " won't be resubmitted before timeout");
606       }
607       final boolean alive =
608           (master.getServerManager() != null && curWorker != null) ? master.getServerManager()
609               .isServerOnline(curWorker) : true;
610       if (alive && time < timeout) {
611         LOG.trace("Skipping the resubmit of " + task.toString() + "  because the server "
612             + task.cur_worker_name + " is not marked as dead, we waited for " + time
613             + " while the timeout is " + timeout);
614         return false;
615       }
616       if (task.unforcedResubmits >= resubmit_threshold) {
617         if (!task.resubmitThresholdReached) {
618           task.resubmitThresholdReached = true;
619           tot_mgr_resubmit_threshold_reached.incrementAndGet();
620           LOG.info("Skipping resubmissions of task " + path +
621               " because threshold " + resubmit_threshold + " reached");
622         }
623         return false;
624       }
625       // race with heartbeat() that might be changing last_version
626       version = task.last_version;
627     } else {
628       version = -1;
629     }
630     LOG.info("resubmitting task " + path);
631     task.incarnation++;
632     try {
633       // blocking zk call but this is done from the timeout thread
634       if (ZKUtil.setData(this.watcher, path,
635           TaskState.TASK_UNASSIGNED.get(serverName),
636           version) == false) {
637         LOG.debug("failed to resubmit task " + path +
638             " version changed");
639         task.heartbeatNoDetails(EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis());
640         return false;
641       }
642     } catch (NoNodeException e) {
643       LOG.warn("failed to resubmit because znode doesn't exist " + path +
644           " task done (or forced done by removing the znode)");
645       getDataSetWatchSuccess(path, null, Integer.MIN_VALUE);
646       return false;
647     } catch (KeeperException.BadVersionException e) {
648       LOG.debug("failed to resubmit task " + path +
649           " version changed");
650       task.heartbeatNoDetails(EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis());
651       return false;
652     } catch (KeeperException e) {
653       tot_mgr_resubmit_failed.incrementAndGet();
654       LOG.warn("failed to resubmit " + path, e);
655       return false;
656     }
657     // don't count forced resubmits
658     if (directive != FORCE) {
659       task.unforcedResubmits++;
660     }
661     task.setUnassigned();
662     createRescanNode(Long.MAX_VALUE);
663     tot_mgr_resubmit.incrementAndGet();
664     return true;
665   }
666 
667   private void resubmitOrFail(String path, ResubmitDirective directive) {
668     if (resubmit(path, findOrCreateOrphanTask(path), directive) == false) {
669       setDone(path, FAILURE);
670     }
671   }
672 
673   private void deleteNode(String path, Long retries) {
674     tot_mgr_node_delete_queued.incrementAndGet();
675     // Once a task znode is ready for delete, that is it is in the TASK_DONE
676     // state, then no one should be writing to it anymore. That is no one
677     // will be updating the znode version any more.
678     this.watcher.getRecoverableZooKeeper().getZooKeeper().
679       delete(path, -1, new DeleteAsyncCallback(),
680         retries);
681   }
682 
683   private void deleteNodeSuccess(String path) {
684     if (ignoreZKDeleteForTesting) {
685       return;
686     }
687     Task task;
688     task = tasks.remove(path);
689     if (task == null) {
690       if (ZKSplitLog.isRescanNode(watcher, path)) {
691         tot_mgr_rescan_deleted.incrementAndGet();
692       }
693       tot_mgr_missing_state_in_delete.incrementAndGet();
694       LOG.debug("deleted task without in memory state " + path);
695       return;
696     }
697     synchronized (task) {
698       task.status = DELETED;
699       task.notify();
700     }
701     tot_mgr_task_deleted.incrementAndGet();
702   }
703 
704   private void deleteNodeFailure(String path) {
705     LOG.info("Failed to delete node " + path + " and will retry soon.");
706     return;
707   }
708 
709   /**
710    * signal the workers that a task was resubmitted by creating the
711    * RESCAN node.
712    * @throws KeeperException 
713    */
714   private void createRescanNode(long retries) {
715     // The RESCAN node will be deleted almost immediately by the
716     // SplitLogManager as soon as it is created because it is being
717     // created in the DONE state. This behavior prevents a buildup
718     // of RESCAN nodes. But there is also a chance that a SplitLogWorker
719     // might miss the watch-trigger that creation of RESCAN node provides.
720     // Since the TimeoutMonitor will keep resubmitting UNASSIGNED tasks
721     // therefore this behavior is safe.
722     this.watcher.getRecoverableZooKeeper().getZooKeeper().
723       create(ZKSplitLog.getRescanNode(watcher),
724         TaskState.TASK_DONE.get(serverName), Ids.OPEN_ACL_UNSAFE,
725         CreateMode.EPHEMERAL_SEQUENTIAL,
726         new CreateRescanAsyncCallback(), Long.valueOf(retries));
727   }
728 
729   private void createRescanSuccess(String path) {
730     lastNodeCreateTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
731     tot_mgr_rescan.incrementAndGet();
732     getDataSetWatch(path, zkretries);
733   }
734 
735   private void createRescanFailure() {
736     LOG.fatal("logic failure, rescan failure must not happen");
737   }
738 
739   /**
740    * @param path
741    * @param batch
742    * @return null on success, existing task on error
743    */
744   private Task createTaskIfAbsent(String path, TaskBatch batch) {
745     Task oldtask;
746     // batch.installed is only changed via this function and
747     // a single thread touches batch.installed.
748     Task newtask = new Task();
749     newtask.batch = batch;
750     oldtask = tasks.putIfAbsent(path, newtask);
751     if (oldtask == null) {
752       batch.installed++;
753       return  null;
754     }
755     // new task was not used.
756     synchronized (oldtask) {
757       if (oldtask.isOrphan()) {
758         if (oldtask.status == SUCCESS) {
759           // The task is already done. Do not install the batch for this
760           // task because it might be too late for setDone() to update
761           // batch.done. There is no need for the batch creator to wait for
762           // this task to complete.
763           return (null);
764         }
765         if (oldtask.status == IN_PROGRESS) {
766           oldtask.batch = batch;
767           batch.installed++;
768           LOG.debug("Previously orphan task " + path +
769               " is now being waited upon");
770           return null;
771         }
772         while (oldtask.status == FAILURE) {
773           LOG.debug("wait for status of task " + path +
774               " to change to DELETED");
775           tot_mgr_wait_for_zk_delete.incrementAndGet();
776           try {
777             oldtask.wait();
778           } catch (InterruptedException e) {
779             Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
780             LOG.warn("Interrupted when waiting for znode delete callback");
781             // fall through to return failure
782             break;
783           }
784         }
785         if (oldtask.status != DELETED) {
786           LOG.warn("Failure because previously failed task" +
787               " state still present. Waiting for znode delete callback" +
788               " path=" + path);
789           return oldtask;
790         }
791         // reinsert the newTask and it must succeed this time
792         Task t = tasks.putIfAbsent(path, newtask);
793         if (t == null) {
794           batch.installed++;
795           return  null;
796         }
797         LOG.fatal("Logic error. Deleted task still present in tasks map");
798         assert false : "Deleted task still present in tasks map";
799         return t;
800       }
801       LOG.warn("Failure because two threads can't wait for the same task. " +
802           " path=" + path);
803       return oldtask;
804     }
805   }
806 
807   Task findOrCreateOrphanTask(String path) {
808     Task orphanTask = new Task();
809     Task task;
810     task = tasks.putIfAbsent(path, orphanTask);
811     if (task == null) {
812       LOG.info("creating orphan task " + path);
813       tot_mgr_orphan_task_acquired.incrementAndGet();
814       task = orphanTask;
815     }
816     return task;
817   }
818 
819   @Override
820   public void nodeDataChanged(String path) {
821     Task task;
822     task = tasks.get(path);
823     if (task != null || ZKSplitLog.isRescanNode(watcher, path)) {
824       if (task != null) {
825         task.heartbeatNoDetails(EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis());
826       }
827       getDataSetWatch(path, zkretries);
828     }
829   }
830 
831   public void stop() {
832     if (timeoutMonitor != null) {
833       timeoutMonitor.interrupt();
834     }
835   }
836 
837   private void lookForOrphans() {
838     List<String> orphans;
839     try {
840        orphans = ZKUtil.listChildrenNoWatch(this.watcher,
841           this.watcher.splitLogZNode);
842       if (orphans == null) {
843         LOG.warn("could not get children of " + this.watcher.splitLogZNode);
844         return;
845       }
846     } catch (KeeperException e) {
847       LOG.warn("could not get children of " + this.watcher.splitLogZNode +
848           " " + StringUtils.stringifyException(e));
849       return;
850     }
851     int rescan_nodes = 0;
852     for (String path : orphans) {
853       String nodepath = ZKUtil.joinZNode(watcher.splitLogZNode, path);
854       if (ZKSplitLog.isRescanNode(watcher, nodepath)) {
855         rescan_nodes++;
856         LOG.debug("found orphan rescan node " + path);
857       } else {
858         LOG.info("found orphan task " + path);
859       }
860       getDataSetWatch(nodepath, zkretries);
861     }
862     LOG.info("found " + (orphans.size() - rescan_nodes) + " orphan tasks and " +
863         rescan_nodes + " rescan nodes");
864   }
865 
866   /**
867    * Keeps track of the batch of tasks submitted together by a caller in
868    * splitLogDistributed(). Clients threads use this object to wait for all
869    * their tasks to be done.
870    * <p>
871    * All access is synchronized.
872    */
873   static class TaskBatch {
874     int installed = 0;
875     int done = 0;
876     int error = 0;
877     volatile boolean isDead = false;
878 
879     @Override
880     public String toString() {
881       return ("installed = " + installed + " done = " + done + " error = "
882           + error);
883     }
884   }
885 
886   /**
887    * in memory state of an active task.
888    */
889   static class Task {
890     volatile long last_update;
891     volatile int last_version;
892     volatile String cur_worker_name;
893     TaskBatch batch;
894     volatile TerminationStatus status;
895     volatile int incarnation;
896     volatile int unforcedResubmits;
897     volatile boolean resubmitThresholdReached;
898 
899     @Override
900     public String toString() {
901       return ("last_update = " + last_update +
902           " last_version = " + last_version +
903           " cur_worker_name = " + cur_worker_name +
904           " status = " + status +
905           " incarnation = " + incarnation +
906           " resubmits = " + unforcedResubmits +
907           " batch = " + batch);
908     }
909 
910     Task() {
911       incarnation = 0;
912       last_version = -1;
913       status = IN_PROGRESS;
914       setUnassigned();
915     }
916 
917     public boolean isOrphan() {
918       return (batch == null || batch.isDead);
919     }
920 
921     public boolean isUnassigned() {
922       return (cur_worker_name == null);
923     }
924 
925     public void heartbeatNoDetails(long time) {
926       last_update = time;
927     }
928 
929     public void heartbeat(long time, int version, String worker) {
930       last_version = version;
931       last_update = time;
932       cur_worker_name = worker;
933     }
934 
935     public void setUnassigned() {
936       cur_worker_name = null;
937       last_update = -1;
938     }
939   }
940 
941   void handleDeadWorker(String workerName) {
942     // resubmit the tasks on the TimeoutMonitor thread. Makes it easier
943     // to reason about concurrency. Makes it easier to retry.
944     synchronized (deadWorkersLock) {
945       if (deadWorkers == null) {
946         deadWorkers = new HashSet<String>(100);
947       }
948       deadWorkers.add(workerName);
949     }
950     LOG.info("dead splitlog worker " + workerName);
951   }
952 
953   void handleDeadWorkers(List<ServerName> serverNames) {
954     List<String> workerNames = new ArrayList<String>(serverNames.size());
955     for (ServerName serverName : serverNames) {
956       workerNames.add(serverName.toString());
957     }
958     synchronized (deadWorkersLock) {
959       if (deadWorkers == null) {
960         deadWorkers = new HashSet<String>(100);
961       }
962       deadWorkers.addAll(workerNames);
963     }
964     LOG.info("dead splitlog workers " + workerNames);
965   }
966 
967   /**
968    * Periodically checks all active tasks and resubmits the ones that have timed
969    * out
970    */
971   private class TimeoutMonitor extends Chore {
972     public TimeoutMonitor(final int period, Stoppable stopper) {
973       super("SplitLogManager Timeout Monitor", period, stopper);
974     }
975 
976     @Override
977     protected void chore() {
978       int resubmitted = 0;
979       int unassigned = 0;
980       int tot = 0;
981       boolean found_assigned_task = false;
982       Set<String> localDeadWorkers;
983 
984       synchronized (deadWorkersLock) {
985         localDeadWorkers = deadWorkers;
986         deadWorkers = null;
987       }
988 
989       for (Map.Entry<String, Task> e : tasks.entrySet()) {
990         String path = e.getKey();
991         Task task = e.getValue();
992         String cur_worker = task.cur_worker_name;
993         tot++;
994         // don't easily resubmit a task which hasn't been picked up yet. It
995         // might be a long while before a SplitLogWorker is free to pick up a
996         // task. This is because a SplitLogWorker picks up a task one at a
997         // time. If we want progress when there are no region servers then we
998         // will have to run a SplitLogWorker thread in the Master.
999         if (task.isUnassigned()) {
1000           unassigned++;
1001           continue;
1002         }
1003         found_assigned_task = true;
1004         if (localDeadWorkers != null && localDeadWorkers.contains(cur_worker)) {
1005           tot_mgr_resubmit_dead_server_task.incrementAndGet();
1006           if (resubmit(path, task, FORCE)) {
1007             resubmitted++;
1008           } else {
1009             handleDeadWorker(cur_worker);
1010             LOG.warn("Failed to resubmit task " + path + " owned by dead " +
1011                 cur_worker + ", will retry.");
1012           }
1013         } else if (resubmit(path, task, CHECK)) {
1014           resubmitted++;
1015         }
1016       }
1017       if (tot > 0) {
1018         LOG.debug("total tasks = " + tot + " unassigned = " + unassigned);
1019       }
1020       if (resubmitted > 0) {
1021         LOG.info("resubmitted " + resubmitted + " out of " + tot + " tasks");
1022       }
1023       // If there are pending tasks and all of them have been unassigned for
1024       // some time then put up a RESCAN node to ping the workers.
1025       // ZKSplitlog.DEFAULT_UNASSIGNED_TIMEOUT is of the order of minutes
1026       // because a. it is very unlikely that every worker had a
1027       // transient error when trying to grab the task b. if there are no
1028       // workers then all tasks wills stay unassigned indefinitely and the
1029       // manager will be indefinitely creating RESCAN nodes. TODO may be the
1030       // master should spawn both a manager and a worker thread to guarantee
1031       // that there is always one worker in the system
1032       if (tot > 0 && !found_assigned_task &&
1033           ((EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis() - lastNodeCreateTime) >
1034           unassignedTimeout)) {
1035         for (Map.Entry<String, Task> e : tasks.entrySet()) {
1036           String path = e.getKey();
1037           Task task = e.getValue();
1038           // we have to do task.isUnassigned() check again because tasks might
1039           // have been asynchronously assigned. There is no locking required
1040           // for these checks ... it is OK even if tryGetDataSetWatch() is
1041           // called unnecessarily for a task
1042           if (task.isUnassigned() && (task.status != FAILURE)) {
1043             // We just touch the znode to make sure its still there
1044             tryGetDataSetWatch(path);
1045           }
1046         }
1047         createRescanNode(Long.MAX_VALUE);
1048         tot_mgr_resubmit_unassigned.incrementAndGet();
1049         LOG.debug("resubmitting unassigned task(s) after timeout");
1050       }
1051 
1052       // Retry previously failed deletes
1053       if (failedDeletions.size() > 0) {
1054         List<String> tmpPaths = new ArrayList<String>(failedDeletions);
1055         failedDeletions.removeAll(tmpPaths);
1056         for (String tmpPath : tmpPaths) {
1057           // deleteNode is an async call
1058           deleteNode(tmpPath, zkretries);
1059         }
1060       }
1061     }
1062   }
1063 
1064   /**
1065    * Asynchronous handler for zk create node results.
1066    * Retries on failures.
1067    */
1068   class CreateAsyncCallback implements AsyncCallback.StringCallback {
1069     private final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(CreateAsyncCallback.class);
1070 
1071     @Override
1072     public void processResult(int rc, String path, Object ctx, String name) {
1073       tot_mgr_node_create_result.incrementAndGet();
1074       if (rc != 0) {
1075         if (shouldAbandonRetries(rc, "Create znode " + path)) {
1076           createNodeFailure(path);
1077           return;
1078         }
1079         if (rc == KeeperException.Code.NODEEXISTS.intValue()) {
1080           // What if there is a delete pending against this pre-existing
1081           // znode? Then this soon-to-be-deleted task znode must be in TASK_DONE
1082           // state. Only operations that will be carried out on this node by
1083           // this manager are get-znode-data, task-finisher and delete-znode.
1084           // And all code pieces correctly handle the case of suddenly
1085           // disappearing task-znode.
1086           LOG.debug("found pre-existing znode " + path);
1087           tot_mgr_node_already_exists.incrementAndGet();
1088         } else {
1089           Long retry_count = (Long)ctx;
1090           LOG.warn("create rc =" + KeeperException.Code.get(rc) + " for " +
1091               path + " remaining retries=" + retry_count);
1092           if (retry_count == 0) {
1093             tot_mgr_node_create_err.incrementAndGet();
1094             createNodeFailure(path);
1095           } else {
1096             tot_mgr_node_create_retry.incrementAndGet();
1097             createNode(path, retry_count - 1);
1098           }
1099           return;
1100         }
1101       }
1102       createNodeSuccess(path);
1103     }
1104   }
1105 
1106   /**
1107    * Asynchronous handler for zk get-data-set-watch on node results.
1108    * Retries on failures.
1109    */
1110   class GetDataAsyncCallback implements AsyncCallback.DataCallback {
1111     private final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(GetDataAsyncCallback.class);
1112 
1113     @Override
1114     public void processResult(int rc, String path, Object ctx, byte[] data,
1115         Stat stat) {
1116       tot_mgr_get_data_result.incrementAndGet();
1117       if (rc != 0) {
1118         if (shouldAbandonRetries(rc, "GetData from znode " + path)) {
1119           return;
1120         }
1121         if (rc == KeeperException.Code.NONODE.intValue()) {
1122           tot_mgr_get_data_nonode.incrementAndGet();
1123           // The task znode has been deleted. Must be some pending delete
1124           // that deleted the task. Assume success because a task-znode is
1125           // is only deleted after TaskFinisher is successful.
1126           LOG.warn("task znode " + path + " vanished.");
1127           getDataSetWatchSuccess(path, null, Integer.MIN_VALUE);
1128           return;
1129         }
1130         Long retry_count = (Long) ctx;
1131 
1132         if (retry_count < 0) {
1133           LOG.warn("getdata rc = " + KeeperException.Code.get(rc) + " " +
1134               path + ". Ignoring error. No error handling. No retrying.");
1135           return;
1136         }
1137         LOG.warn("getdata rc = " + KeeperException.Code.get(rc) + " " +
1138             path + " remaining retries=" + retry_count);
1139         if (retry_count == 0) {
1140           tot_mgr_get_data_err.incrementAndGet();
1141           getDataSetWatchFailure(path);
1142         } else {
1143           tot_mgr_get_data_retry.incrementAndGet();
1144           getDataSetWatch(path, retry_count - 1);
1145         }
1146         return;
1147       }
1148       getDataSetWatchSuccess(path, data, stat.getVersion());
1149       return;
1150     }
1151   }
1152 
1153   /**
1154    * Asynchronous handler for zk delete node results.
1155    * Retries on failures.
1156    */
1157   class DeleteAsyncCallback implements AsyncCallback.VoidCallback {
1158     private final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(DeleteAsyncCallback.class);
1159 
1160     @Override
1161     public void processResult(int rc, String path, Object ctx) {
1162       tot_mgr_node_delete_result.incrementAndGet();
1163       if (rc != 0) {
1164         if (shouldAbandonRetries(rc, "Delete znode " + path)) {
1165           failedDeletions.add(path);
1166           return;
1167         }
1168         if (rc != KeeperException.Code.NONODE.intValue()) {
1169           tot_mgr_node_delete_err.incrementAndGet();
1170           Long retry_count = (Long) ctx;
1171           LOG.warn("delete rc=" + KeeperException.Code.get(rc) + " for " +
1172               path + " remaining retries=" + retry_count);
1173           if (retry_count == 0) {
1174             LOG.warn("delete failed " + path);
1175             failedDeletions.add(path);
1176             deleteNodeFailure(path);
1177           } else {
1178             deleteNode(path, retry_count - 1);
1179           }
1180           return;
1181         } else {
1182         LOG.debug(path +
1183             " does not exist. Either was created but deleted behind our" +
1184             " back by another pending delete OR was deleted" +
1185             " in earlier retry rounds. zkretries = " + (Long) ctx);
1186         }
1187       } else {
1188         LOG.debug("deleted " + path);
1189       }
1190       deleteNodeSuccess(path);
1191     }
1192   }
1193 
1194   /**
1195    * Asynchronous handler for zk create RESCAN-node results.
1196    * Retries on failures.
1197    * <p>
1198    * A RESCAN node is created using PERSISTENT_SEQUENTIAL flag. It is a signal
1199    * for all the {@link SplitLogWorker}s to rescan for new tasks.
1200    */
1201   class CreateRescanAsyncCallback implements AsyncCallback.StringCallback {
1202     private final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(CreateRescanAsyncCallback.class);
1203 
1204     @Override
1205     public void processResult(int rc, String path, Object ctx, String name) {
1206       if (rc != 0) {
1207         if (shouldAbandonRetries(rc, "CreateRescan znode " + path)) {
1208           return;
1209         }
1210         Long retry_count = (Long)ctx;
1211         LOG.warn("rc=" + KeeperException.Code.get(rc) + " for "+ path +
1212             " remaining retries=" + retry_count);
1213         if (retry_count == 0) {
1214           createRescanFailure();
1215         } else {
1216           createRescanNode(retry_count - 1);
1217         }
1218         return;
1219       }
1220       // path is the original arg, name is the actual name that was created
1221       createRescanSuccess(name);
1222     }
1223   }
1224 
1225   /**
1226    * {@link SplitLogManager} can use objects implementing this interface to
1227    * finish off a partially done task by {@link SplitLogWorker}. This provides
1228    * a serialization point at the end of the task processing. Must be
1229    * restartable and idempotent.
1230    */
1231   static public interface TaskFinisher {
1232     /**
1233      * status that can be returned finish()
1234      */
1235     static public enum Status {
1236       /**
1237        * task completed successfully
1238        */
1239       DONE(),
1240       /**
1241        * task completed with error
1242        */
1243       ERR();
1244     }
1245     /**
1246      * finish the partially done task. workername provides clue to where the
1247      * partial results of the partially done tasks are present. taskname is the
1248      * name of the task that was put up in zookeeper.
1249      * <p>
1250      * @param workerName
1251      * @param taskname
1252      * @return DONE if task completed successfully, ERR otherwise
1253      */
1254     public Status finish(String workerName, String taskname);
1255   }
1256   enum ResubmitDirective {
1257     CHECK(),
1258     FORCE();
1259   }
1260   enum TerminationStatus {
1261     IN_PROGRESS("in_progress"),
1262     SUCCESS("success"),
1263     FAILURE("failure"),
1264     DELETED("deleted");
1265 
1266     String statusMsg;
1267     TerminationStatus(String msg) {
1268       statusMsg = msg;
1269     }
1270     
1271     @Override
1272     public String toString() {
1273       return statusMsg;
1274     }
1275   }
1276   
1277   /**
1278    * Completes the initialization
1279    */
1280   public void finishInitialization() {
1281     finishInitialization(false);
1282   }
